alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 5:05AM MST until September 01 at 7:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM MST THIS MORNING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 503 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or has already occurred. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Castle Hot Springs, Coles Bay, Castle Creek Boat Ramp, Goose Bay, Cottonwood Day Use Area, Pipeline Canyon Trailhead, Humbug Bay and Lake Pleasant. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Bitter Creek, Black Butte Wash, Whipsaw Creek, Castle Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Humbug Creek, Minnehaha Creek, Buckhorn Creek, Banty Creek, Jim Creek, Tiger Creek, Cherry Creek, Buzzard Roost Creek, Agua Fria River, Boulder Creek, Ash Creek and Sand Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
